text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
NutritionOrder NDomainResourceDiet, formula or nutritional supplement request
+ Rule: Nutrition Order SHALL contain either Oral Diet , Supplement, or Enteral Formula class

Elements defined in Ancestors: id, meta, implicitRules, language, text, contained, extension, modifierExtension
identifier 0..*IdentifierIdentifiers assigned to this order

basedOn 0..*Reference(CarePlan | NutritionOrder | ServiceRequest | RequestOrchestration)What this order fulfills

groupIdentifier Σ0..1IdentifierComposite Request ID
status ?!Σ1..1codedraft | active | on-hold | entered-in-error | ended | completed | revoked | unknown
Binding: RequestStatus (Required)
intent ?!Σ1..1codeproposal | solicit-offer | offer-response | plan | directive | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
Binding: RequestIntent (Required)
priority 0..1coderoutine | urgent | asap | stat
Binding: RequestPriority (Required)
subject Σ1..1Reference(Patient | Group)Who requires the diet, formula or nutritional supplement
encounter 0..1Reference(Encounter)The encounter associated with this nutrition order
supportingInformation 0..*Reference(Any)Information to support fulfilling of the nutrition order

dateTime Σ1..1dateTimeDate and time the nutrition order was requested
requester Σ0..1Reference(Practitioner | PractitionerRole)Who ordered the diet, formula or nutritional supplement
performer 0..*CodeableReference(CareTeam | Practitioner | PractitionerRole | RelatedPerson | Patient | Organization | Group)Who is intended to perform the administration of the nutrition order

allergyIntolerance 0..*Reference(AllergyIntolerance)List of the patient's food and nutrition-related allergies and intolerances

foodPreferenceModifier 0..*CodeableConceptOrder-specific modifier about the type of food that should be given
Binding: Types of Edible Substances (Preferred)

excludeFoodModifier 0..*CodeableConceptFood that should not be given
Binding: Types of Edible Substances (Preferred)

outsideFoodAllowed 0..1booleanCapture if patient is permitted to consume food from outside of current setting brought by the patient, family, and/or caregiver
oralDiet C0..1BackboneElementOral diet components
type Σ0..*CodeableConceptType of oral diet or diet restrictions that can be consumed orally
Binding: Diet Codes (Preferred)

schedule 0..1BackboneElementScheduling information for oral diets
timing 0..*TimingScheduled frequency of diet

asNeeded 0..1booleanTake 'as needed'
asNeededFor 0..1CodeableConceptTake 'as needed' for x
Binding: SNOMED CT Medication As Needed Reason Codes (Example)
nutrient 0..*BackboneElementThe nutrient that is modified and the quantity in the diet

modifier 0..1CodeableConceptNutrient modified in the oral diet type
Binding: Nutrient Codes (Preferred)
amount 0..1QuantityQuantity of the specified nutrient
texture 0..*BackboneElementTexture modifications in addition to the oral diet type

modifier 0..1CodeableConceptFood (i.e. solid and/or liquid) texture modifications in addition to those in the oral diet type
Binding: Texture Modifier Codes (Preferred)
type 0..1CodeableConceptFood (i.e. solid and/or liquid) types that undergo texture alteration
Binding: Texture Modified Food Type Codes (Preferred)
instruction Σ0..1stringInstructions or additional information about the oral diet
caloricDensity 0..1QuantityAmount of energy per specified volume of oral diet
supplement C0..*BackboneElementSupplement components

type Σ0..1CodeableReference(NutritionProduct)Type of supplement product requested
Binding: Supplement Type Codes (Preferred)
productName 0..1stringProduct or brand name of the nutritional supplement
schedule 0..1BackboneElementScheduling information for supplements
timing 0..*TimingScheduled frequency of supplement

asNeeded 0..1booleanTake 'as needed'
asNeededFor 0..1CodeableConceptTake 'as needed' for x
Binding: SNOMED CT Medication As Needed Reason Codes (Example)
quantity 0..1QuantityAmount of the nutritional supplement
instruction Σ0..1stringInstructions or additional information about the oral supplement
caloricDensity 0..1QuantityAmount of energy per specified volume of supplement that is required
enteralFormula C0..1BackboneElementEnteral formula product
type Σ0..1CodeableReference(NutritionProduct)Type of patient enteral feeding
Binding: Enteral Formula Type Codes (Preferred)
productName 0..1stringProduct or brand name of the enteral feeding
deliveryDevice[x] 0..1Intended type of device for the enteral feeding administration
Binding: Delivery Device Code (Example)
deliveryDeviceCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
deliveryDeviceCanonicalcanonical(DeviceDefinition)
caloricDensity 0..1QuantityAmount of energy per specified volume of feeding that is required
routeOfAdministration 0..*CodeableConceptHow the enteral feeding should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract
Binding: Enteral Route Codes (Extensible)

administration 0..*BackboneElementFormula feeding instruction as structured data

schedule 0..1BackboneElementScheduling information for enteral feeding products
timing 0..*TimingScheduled frequency of enteral feeding

asNeeded 0..1booleanTake 'as needed'
asNeededFor 0..1CodeableConceptTake 'as needed' for x
Binding: SNOMED CT Medication As Needed Reason Codes (Example)
quantity 0..1QuantityThe volume of formula feeding to provide
rate[x] 0..1Speed with which the formula feeding is provided per period of time
rateQuantityQuantity
rateRatioRatio
maxVolumeToAdminister 0..1QuantityUpper limit on formula feeding volume per unit of time
administrationInstruction Σ0..1markdownFormula feeding instructions expressed as text
additive 0..*BackboneElementModular additive to add to the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding

modularType 0..1CodeableReference(NutritionProduct)Type of modular component to add to the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding
Binding: Enteral Formula Additive Type Code (Preferred)
productName 0..1stringProduct or brand name of the modular additive
quantity 0..1QuantityAmount of additive to be given or mixed in with the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding
routeOfAdministration 0..*CodeableConceptHow the additive should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract
Binding: Enteral Route Codes (Extensible)

note 0..*AnnotationComments


Documentation for this format

name: NutritionOrder
description: A request to supply a diet, formula feeding (enteral) or oral nutritional supplement to an individual or group.

element.short: Diet, formula or nutritional supplement request
element.definition: A request to supply a diet, formula feeding (enteral) or oral nutritional supplement to an individual or group.
element.comment: Referenced by an Order Request (workflow).

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id.trace('id') in %resource.descendants().select(reference | as(uri))) or descendants().where(reference='#' | as(uri)='#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management
Nutrition Order SHALL contain either Oral Diet , Supplement, or Enteral Formula class

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: Within the context of the FHIR RESTful interactions, the resource has an id except for cases like the create and conditional update. Otherwise, the use of the resouce id depends on the given use case.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc. For DomainResources, if more than one implicitRules policy applies, additional policies may be conveyed using the [additionalImplicitRules](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-extensions/StructureDefinition-additionalImplicitRules.html) extension.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of its narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies its meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: IETF language tag for a human language

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have a narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contained, inline Resources
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags in their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels. Contained resources may be a resource type defined in the FHIR specification, or an [additional resource](resource.html#additional).

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.short: Identifiers assigned to this order
element.definition: Identifiers assigned to this order by the order sender or by the order receiver.
element.comment: The Identifier.type element can be to indicate filler vs. placer if needed.  This is explained in further detail [here](servicerequest.html#notes).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: What this order fulfills
element.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this nutrition order.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Composite Request ID
element.definition: A shared identifier common to all nutrition orders that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the composite or group identifier.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: draft | active | on-hold | entered-in-error | ended | completed | revoked | unknown
element.definition: The workflow status of the nutrition order/request.
element.comment: Typically the system placing the order sets the status to "requested". Thereafter, the order is maintained by the receiver that updates the status as the request is handled.  This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of the nutrition order.

element.short: proposal | solicit-offer | offer-response | plan | directive | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
element.definition: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the NutrionOrder and where the request fits into the workflow chain.
element.comment: When resources map to this element, they are free to define as many codes as necessary to cover their space and will map to "proposal, plan or order".  Can have multiple codes that map to one of these.  E.g. "original order", "encoded order", "reflex order" would all map to "order".  Expectation is that the set of codes is mutually exclusive or a strict all-encompassing hierarchy.
element.requirements: Proposals/recommendations, plans and orders all use the same structure and can exist in the same fulfillment chain.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element changes the interpretation of all descriptive attributes. For example "the time the request is recommended to occur" vs. "the time the request is authorized to occur" or "who is recommended to perform the request" vs. "who is authorized to perform the request

binding.description: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a nutrition order.

mapping.map: .moodCode (nuances beyond PRP/PLAN/RQO would need to be elsewhere)

element.short: routine | urgent | asap | stat
element.definition: Indicates how quickly the Nutrition Order should be addressed with respect to other        requests.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

element.short: Who requires the diet, formula or nutritional supplement
element.definition: The person or set of individuals who needs the nutrition order for an oral diet, nutritional supplement and/or enteral or formula feeding.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The encounter associated with this nutrition order
element.definition: An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Information to support fulfilling of the nutrition order
element.definition: Information to support fulfilling (i.e. dispensing or administering) of the nutrition,        for example, patient height and weight).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Date and time the nutrition order was requested
element.definition: The date and time that this nutrition order was requested.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Who ordered the diet, formula or nutritional supplement
element.definition: The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the diet, nutritional supplement, or formula feedings.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Who is intended to perform the administration of the nutrition order
element.definition: The specified desired performer of the nutrition order.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: List of the patient's food and nutrition-related allergies and intolerances
element.definition: A link to a record of allergies or intolerances  which should be included in the nutrition order.
element.comment: Information on a patient's food allergies and intolerances to inform healthcare personnel about the type of foods that the patient shouldn't receive or consume.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should be given
element.definition: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food (i.e. solid and/or liquid) that should be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as Halal, Vegan or Kosher. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.
element.comment: Information on a patient's preferences that informs the healthcare personnel about what the patient should receive or consume.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Medical, cultural or ethical food preferences to help with catering requirements.

element.short: Food that should not be given
element.definition: This modifier is used to convey Order-specific modifiers that should not be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as No Red Meat, No Soy or No Wheat or Gluten-Free. While it should not be necessary to repeat allergy or intolerance information captured in the referenced AllergyIntolerance resource in the excludeFoodModifier, this element may be used to convey additional specificity related to what should be eliminated from the patient’s diet for any reason. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.
element.comment: Specific types of oral food (solid/liquid) to avoid.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes used to indicate the type of food that should NOT be given to the patient.

element.short: Capture if patient is permitted to consume food from outside of current setting brought by the patient, family, and/or caregiver
element.definition: This modifier is used to convey whether a food item, brought in by the patient, family, and/or caregiver, can be consumed by the patient.  If set to true, indicates that the receiving system does not need to supply the food item.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Oral diet components
element.definition: Diet given orally that may include texture modification, such as International Dysphagia Diet Standardisation Initiative Framework - Slightly Thick Level 1 drinks and Minced and International Dysphagia Diet Standardisation Initiative Framework - Minced and Moist Level 5 food as well as, for example, Decreased potassium diet (ie, nutrient modification), Halal diet (ie, cultural modification), and/or Low microbial diet (eg, other modification).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children or both

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Type of oral diet or diet restrictions that can be consumed orally
element.definition: The kind of diet or dietary restriction such as fiber restricted diet or diet for diabetes.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes used to indicate the type of diet being ordered for a patient.

element.short: Scheduling information for oral diets
element.definition: Schedule information for an oral diet.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children or both

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Scheduled frequency of diet
element.definition: The time period and frequency at which the diet should be given.  The diet should be given for the combination of all schedules if more than one schedule is present.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Take 'as needed'
element.definition: Indicates whether the diet is only taken when needed within a specific administration schedule.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Take 'as needed' for x
element.definition: Indicates whether the diet is only taken based on a precondition for taking the diet.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

extension.valueMarkdown: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming a nutrition product.

binding.description: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming a nutrition product.

element.short: The nutrient that is modified and the quantity in the diet
element.definition: Defines the quantity and the nutrient modified (for example carbohydrate, fiber or sodium) in the oral diet.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children or both

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Nutrient modified in the oral diet type
element.definition: The nutrient that is being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes for types of nutrients that are being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.

element.short: Quantity of the specified nutrient
element.definition: The quantity of the specified nutrient to include in diet.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Texture modifications in addition to the oral diet type
element.definition: Class that describes any texture modifications in addition to the oral diet type required for the patient to safely consume various types of foods (i.e. solid and/or liquid).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children or both

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Food (i.e. solid and/or liquid) texture modifications in addition to those in the oral diet type
element.definition: Texture modifications in the addition to the oral diet type that should be made, e.g. easy to chew, chopped, ground, and pureed.
element.comment: Coupled with the foodType (Meat).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Texture modifications for oral diets.

element.short: Food (i.e. solid and/or liquid) types that undergo texture alteration
element.definition: The food (i.e. solid and/or liquid) type(s) (e.g. meats, all foods)  that the texture modification applies to.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes identifying food types that undergo texture modification.

element.short: Instructions or additional information about the oral diet
element.definition: Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral diet.
element.comment: Free text diet instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Amount of energy per specified volume of oral diet
element.definition: The amount of energy (calories or kilojoules) that the oral diet should provide.  For example, an infant formula feeding of 30 ounces of 20 kcal/ounce (67 kcal/100 mL) formula per day.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Supplement components
element.definition: Oral nutritional products given in order to add further nutritional value to the patient's diet.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Scheduled frequency of supplement
element.definition: The time period and frequency at which the supplement should be given.  The supplement should be given for the combination of all schedules if more than one schedule is present.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Take 'as needed'
element.definition: Indicates whether the supplement is only taken when needed within a specific dosing schedule.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Take 'as needed' for x
element.definition: Indicates whether the supplement is only taken based on a precondition for taking the supplement.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

extension.valueMarkdown: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming a supplement.

binding.description: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming a supplement.

element.short: Amount of the nutritional supplement
element.definition: The amount of the nutritional supplement to be given.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Instructions or additional information about the oral supplement
element.definition: Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral supplement.
element.comment: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Amount of energy per specified volume of supplement that is required
element.definition: The amount of energy (calories or kilojoules) that the supplement should provide per specified volume, typically per ml or fluid oz.  For example, a patient may required a supplement that provides 24 calories per fluid ounce.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Enteral formula product
element.definition: Feeding provided through the gastrointestinal tract via a tube, catheter, or stoma that delivers nutrition distal to the oral cavity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Type of patient enteral feeding
element.definition: The type of adult or pediatric enteral feeding such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant feeding.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes for type of enteral formula to be administered to patient.

element.short: Product or brand name of the enteral feeding
element.definition: The product or brand name of the enteral feeding product such as "ACME Adult Standard Formula".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Intended type of device for the enteral feeding administration
element.definition: The intended type of device that is to be used for the administration of the enteral formula.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes for devices used for enteral formula delivery.

element.short: Amount of energy per specified volume of feeding that is required
element.definition: The amount of energy (calories or kilojoules) that the feeding should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz.  For example, an infant may require a formula that provides 24 calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that provides 1.5 calorie/mL.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: How the enteral feeding should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract
element.definition: The administration into the patient's gastrointestinal  tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g. nasogastric tube, oral.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes specifying the route of administration of enteral formula.

element.short: Formula feeding instruction as structured data
element.definition: Formula feeding administration instructions as structured data.  This repeating structure allows for changing the administration rate or volume over time for both bolus and continuous feeding.  An example of this would be an instruction to increase the rate of continuous feeding every 2 hours.
element.comment: See implementation notes below for further discussion on how to order continuous vs bolus enteral feeding using this resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children or both

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Scheduled frequency of enteral feeding
element.definition: The time period and frequency at which the enteral feeding should be given.  The enteral feeding should be given for the combination of all schedules if more than one schedule is present.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Take 'as needed'
element.definition: Indicates whether the enteral feeding is only taken when needed within a specific dosing schedule.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Take 'as needed' for x
element.definition: Indicates whether the enteral feeding is only taken based on a precondition for taking the enteral feeding.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

extension.valueMarkdown: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming an enteral formula.

binding.description: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming an enteral formula.

element.short: The volume of formula feeding to provide
element.definition: The volume of formula feeding to provide to the patient per the specified administration schedule.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Speed with which the formula feeding is provided per period of time
element.definition: The rate of administration of formula feeding via a feeding pump, e.g. 60 mL per hour, according to the specified schedule.
element.comment: Ratio is used when the quantity value in the denominator is not "1", otherwise use Quantity. For example, the Ratio datatype is used for "200 mL/4 hrs" versus the Quantity datatype for "50 mL/hr".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Upper limit on formula feeding volume per unit of time
element.definition: The maximum total quantity of formula feeding that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g. 1440 mL over 24 hours.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Formula feeding instructions expressed as text
element.definition: Free text formula administration, feeding instructions or additional instructions or information.
element.comment: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Modular additive to add to the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding
element.definition: Indicates modular components to be provided in addition or mixed with the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children or both

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Type of modular component to add to the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding
element.definition: Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes for the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

mapping.map: N/A (not differentiated from NutritionalFormulaType in HL7 v3)

element.short: Product or brand name of the modular additive
element.definition: The product or brand name of the type of modular additive to be added to the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Amount of additive to be given or mixed in with the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding
element.definition: The amount of additive to be given in addition or to be mixed in with the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: How the additive should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract
element.definition: The administration into the patient's gastrointestinal  tract for purposes of providing the additive, e.g. nasogastric tube, oral.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes specifying the route of administration of additive.

element.short: Comments
element.definition: Comments made about the nutrition order by the requester, performer, subject or other participants.
element.comment: This element SHALL NOT be used to supply free text instructions for the diet which are represented in the `.oralDiet.instruction`, `supplement.instruction`, or `enteralFormula.administrationInstruction` elements.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Diet, formula or nutritional supplement request
element.definition: A request to supply a diet, formula feeding (enteral) or oral nutritional supplement to an individual or group.
element.comment: Referenced by an Order Request (workflow).

constraint.human: Nutrition Order SHALL contain either Oral Diet , Supplement, or Enteral Formula class

element.short: Identifiers assigned to this order
element.definition: Identifiers assigned to this order by the order sender or by the order receiver.
element.comment: The Identifier.type element can be to indicate filler vs. placer if needed.  This is explained in further detail [here](servicerequest.html#notes).

element.short: What this order fulfills
element.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this nutrition order.

element.short: Composite Request ID
element.definition: A shared identifier common to all nutrition orders that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the composite or group identifier.

element.short: draft | active | on-hold | entered-in-error | ended | completed | revoked | unknown
element.definition: The workflow status of the nutrition order/request.
element.comment: Typically the system placing the order sets the status to "requested". Thereafter, the order is maintained by the receiver that updates the status as the request is handled.  This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.
element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of the nutrition order.

element.short: proposal | solicit-offer | offer-response | plan | directive | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
element.definition: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the NutrionOrder and where the request fits into the workflow chain.
element.comment: When resources map to this element, they are free to define as many codes as necessary to cover their space and will map to "proposal, plan or order".  Can have multiple codes that map to one of these.  E.g. "original order", "encoded order", "reflex order" would all map to "order".  Expectation is that the set of codes is mutually exclusive or a strict all-encompassing hierarchy.
element.requirements: Proposals/recommendations, plans and orders all use the same structure and can exist in the same fulfillment chain.
element.isModifierReason: This element changes the interpretation of all descriptive attributes. For example "the time the request is recommended to occur" vs. "the time the request is authorized to occur" or "who is recommended to perform the request" vs. "who is authorized to perform the request

binding.description: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a nutrition order.

mapping.map: .moodCode (nuances beyond PRP/PLAN/RQO would need to be elsewhere)

element.short: routine | urgent | asap | stat
element.definition: Indicates how quickly the Nutrition Order should be addressed with respect to other        requests.

binding.description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

element.short: Who requires the diet, formula or nutritional supplement
element.definition: The person or set of individuals who needs the nutrition order for an oral diet, nutritional supplement and/or enteral or formula feeding.

element.short: The encounter associated with this nutrition order
element.definition: An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

element.short: Information to support fulfilling of the nutrition order
element.definition: Information to support fulfilling (i.e. dispensing or administering) of the nutrition,        for example, patient height and weight).

element.short: Date and time the nutrition order was requested
element.definition: The date and time that this nutrition order was requested.

element.short: Who ordered the diet, formula or nutritional supplement
element.definition: The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the diet, nutritional supplement, or formula feedings.

element.short: Who is intended to perform the administration of the nutrition order
element.definition: The specified desired performer of the nutrition order.

element.short: List of the patient's food and nutrition-related allergies and intolerances
element.definition: A link to a record of allergies or intolerances  which should be included in the nutrition order.
element.comment: Information on a patient's food allergies and intolerances to inform healthcare personnel about the type of foods that the patient shouldn't receive or consume.

element.short: Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should be given
element.definition: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food (i.e. solid and/or liquid) that should be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as Halal, Vegan or Kosher. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.
element.comment: Information on a patient's preferences that informs the healthcare personnel about what the patient should receive or consume.

binding.description: Medical, cultural or ethical food preferences to help with catering requirements.

element.short: Food that should not be given
element.definition: This modifier is used to convey Order-specific modifiers that should not be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as No Red Meat, No Soy or No Wheat or Gluten-Free. While it should not be necessary to repeat allergy or intolerance information captured in the referenced AllergyIntolerance resource in the excludeFoodModifier, this element may be used to convey additional specificity related to what should be eliminated from the patient’s diet for any reason. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.
element.comment: Specific types of oral food (solid/liquid) to avoid.

binding.description: Codes used to indicate the type of food that should NOT be given to the patient.

element.short: Capture if patient is permitted to consume food from outside of current setting brought by the patient, family, and/or caregiver
element.definition: This modifier is used to convey whether a food item, brought in by the patient, family, and/or caregiver, can be consumed by the patient.  If set to true, indicates that the receiving system does not need to supply the food item.

element.short: Oral diet components
element.definition: Diet given orally that may include texture modification, such as International Dysphagia Diet Standardisation Initiative Framework - Slightly Thick Level 1 drinks and Minced and International Dysphagia Diet Standardisation Initiative Framework - Minced and Moist Level 5 food as well as, for example, Decreased potassium diet (ie, nutrient modification), Halal diet (ie, cultural modification), and/or Low microbial diet (eg, other modification).

element.short: Type of oral diet or diet restrictions that can be consumed orally
element.definition: The kind of diet or dietary restriction such as fiber restricted diet or diet for diabetes.

binding.description: Codes used to indicate the type of diet being ordered for a patient.

element.short: Scheduling information for oral diets
element.definition: Schedule information for an oral diet.

element.short: Scheduled frequency of diet
element.definition: The time period and frequency at which the diet should be given.  The diet should be given for the combination of all schedules if more than one schedule is present.

element.short: Take 'as needed'
element.definition: Indicates whether the diet is only taken when needed within a specific administration schedule.

element.short: Take 'as needed' for x
element.definition: Indicates whether the diet is only taken based on a precondition for taking the diet.

extension.valueMarkdown: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming a nutrition product.

binding.description: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming a nutrition product.

element.short: The nutrient that is modified and the quantity in the diet
element.definition: Defines the quantity and the nutrient modified (for example carbohydrate, fiber or sodium) in the oral diet.

element.short: Nutrient modified in the oral diet type
element.definition: The nutrient that is being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.

binding.description: Codes for types of nutrients that are being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.

element.short: Quantity of the specified nutrient
element.definition: The quantity of the specified nutrient to include in diet.

element.short: Texture modifications in addition to the oral diet type
element.definition: Class that describes any texture modifications in addition to the oral diet type required for the patient to safely consume various types of foods (i.e. solid and/or liquid).

element.short: Food (i.e. solid and/or liquid) texture modifications in addition to those in the oral diet type
element.definition: Texture modifications in the addition to the oral diet type that should be made, e.g. easy to chew, chopped, ground, and pureed.
element.comment: Coupled with the foodType (Meat).

binding.description: Texture modifications for oral diets.

element.short: Food (i.e. solid and/or liquid) types that undergo texture alteration
element.definition: The food (i.e. solid and/or liquid) type(s) (e.g. meats, all foods)  that the texture modification applies to.

binding.description: Codes identifying food types that undergo texture modification.

element.short: Instructions or additional information about the oral diet
element.definition: Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral diet.
element.comment: Free text diet instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

element.short: Amount of energy per specified volume of oral diet
element.definition: The amount of energy (calories or kilojoules) that the oral diet should provide.  For example, an infant formula feeding of 30 ounces of 20 kcal/ounce (67 kcal/100 mL) formula per day.

element.short: Supplement components
element.definition: Oral nutritional products given in order to add further nutritional value to the patient's diet.

element.short: Type of supplement product requested
element.definition: The kind of nutritional supplement product required such as a high protein or pediatric clear liquid supplement.

binding.description: Codes for nutritional supplements to be provided to the patient.

element.short: Product or brand name of the nutritional supplement
element.definition: The product or brand name of the nutritional supplement such as "Acme Protein Shake".

element.short: Scheduling information for supplements
element.definition: Schedule information for a supplement.

element.short: Scheduled frequency of supplement
element.definition: The time period and frequency at which the supplement should be given.  The supplement should be given for the combination of all schedules if more than one schedule is present.

element.short: Take 'as needed'
element.definition: Indicates whether the supplement is only taken when needed within a specific dosing schedule.

element.short: Take 'as needed' for x
element.definition: Indicates whether the supplement is only taken based on a precondition for taking the supplement.

extension.valueMarkdown: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming a supplement.

binding.description: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming a supplement.

element.short: Amount of the nutritional supplement
element.definition: The amount of the nutritional supplement to be given.

element.short: Instructions or additional information about the oral supplement
element.definition: Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral supplement.
element.comment: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

element.short: Amount of energy per specified volume of supplement that is required
element.definition: The amount of energy (calories or kilojoules) that the supplement should provide per specified volume, typically per ml or fluid oz.  For example, a patient may required a supplement that provides 24 calories per fluid ounce.

element.short: Enteral formula product
element.definition: Feeding provided through the gastrointestinal tract via a tube, catheter, or stoma that delivers nutrition distal to the oral cavity.

element.short: Type of patient enteral feeding
element.definition: The type of adult or pediatric enteral feeding such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant feeding.

binding.description: Codes for type of enteral formula to be administered to patient.

element.short: Product or brand name of the enteral feeding
element.definition: The product or brand name of the enteral feeding product such as "ACME Adult Standard Formula".

element.short: Intended type of device for the enteral feeding administration
element.definition: The intended type of device that is to be used for the administration of the enteral formula.

binding.description: Codes for devices used for enteral formula delivery.

element.short: Amount of energy per specified volume of feeding that is required
element.definition: The amount of energy (calories or kilojoules) that the feeding should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz.  For example, an infant may require a formula that provides 24 calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that provides 1.5 calorie/mL.

element.short: How the enteral feeding should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract
element.definition: The administration into the patient's gastrointestinal  tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g. nasogastric tube, oral.

binding.description: Codes specifying the route of administration of enteral formula.

element.short: Formula feeding instruction as structured data
element.definition: Formula feeding administration instructions as structured data.  This repeating structure allows for changing the administration rate or volume over time for both bolus and continuous feeding.  An example of this would be an instruction to increase the rate of continuous feeding every 2 hours.
element.comment: See implementation notes below for further discussion on how to order continuous vs bolus enteral feeding using this resource.

element.short: Scheduling information for enteral feeding products
element.definition: Schedule information for an enteral feeding.

element.short: Scheduled frequency of enteral feeding
element.definition: The time period and frequency at which the enteral feeding should be given.  The enteral feeding should be given for the combination of all schedules if more than one schedule is present.

element.short: Take 'as needed'
element.definition: Indicates whether the enteral feeding is only taken when needed within a specific dosing schedule.

element.short: Take 'as needed' for x
element.definition: Indicates whether the enteral feeding is only taken based on a precondition for taking the enteral feeding.

extension.valueMarkdown: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming an enteral formula.

binding.description: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to       consuming an enteral formula.

element.short: The volume of formula feeding to provide
element.definition: The volume of formula feeding to provide to the patient per the specified administration schedule.

element.short: Speed with which the formula feeding is provided per period of time
element.definition: The rate of administration of formula feeding via a feeding pump, e.g. 60 mL per hour, according to the specified schedule.
element.comment: Ratio is used when the quantity value in the denominator is not "1", otherwise use Quantity. For example, the Ratio datatype is used for "200 mL/4 hrs" versus the Quantity datatype for "50 mL/hr".

element.short: Upper limit on formula feeding volume per unit of time
element.definition: The maximum total quantity of formula feeding that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g. 1440 mL over 24 hours.

element.short: Formula feeding instructions expressed as text
element.definition: Free text formula administration, feeding instructions or additional instructions or information.
element.comment: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

element.short: Modular additive to add to the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding
element.definition: Indicates modular components to be provided in addition or mixed with the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding.

element.short: Type of modular component to add to the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding
element.definition: Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding.

binding.description: Codes for the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

mapping.map: N/A (not differentiated from NutritionalFormulaType in HL7 v3)

element.short: Product or brand name of the modular additive
element.definition: The product or brand name of the type of modular additive to be added to the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding.

element.short: Amount of additive to be given or mixed in with the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding
element.definition: The amount of additive to be given in addition or to be mixed in with the oral diet, supplement, and/or enteral feeding.

element.short: How the additive should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract
element.definition: The administration into the patient's gastrointestinal  tract for purposes of providing the additive, e.g. nasogastric tube, oral.

binding.description: Codes specifying the route of administration of additive.

element.short: Comments
element.definition: Comments made about the nutrition order by the requester, performer, subject or other participants.
element.comment: This element SHALL NOT be used to supply free text instructions for the diet which are represented in the `.oralDiet.instruction`, `supplement.instruction`, or `enteralFormula.administrationInstruction` elements.
